triples.name: Chatbot
triples.relevance: The paper addresses chatbot applications and their deployment across various domains and platforms.

triples.name: Domain-specific language
triples.relevance: Xatkit uses Domain Specific Languages as a core technique to define chatbots in a platform-independent manner.

triples.name: Natural language processing
triples.relevance: The paper references NL engines as a configurable component that can be swapped in chatbot applications.

triples.name: Voice user interface
triples.relevance: The paper addresses voicebots and voice-based interactions as an extension of the chatbot framework.

triples.name: Software deployment
triples.relevance: Xatkit provides automatic deployment capabilities for chatbot applications across multiple platforms.

triples.name: E-commerce
triples.relevance: E-commerce is identified as one of the key application domains where chatbots are deployed for customer communication.

triples.name: Low-code development platform
triples.relevance: Xatkit is a low-code framework that enables easier chatbot development without requiring advanced technical knowledge.
